After many years since the start of the civil war in South Sudan, the US imposed an arms embargo on the state in February, signaling that the international community must do more to end the conflict. At that time, the State Dept.'s spokeswoman said the administration would start to resume a push for the UN Security Council to impose a global arms ban against South Sudan. Less than a month ago, the UN Security Council adopted a US-drafted resolution that didn't impose an arms embargo but, “expresses its intention to consider all measures, including an arms embargo, as appropriate, to deprive the parties of the means to continue fighting and to prevent violations” of the December cease-fire agreement.
